thread.title: Church hits out at longer Sunday trading hours as Conservative MPs threaten to rebel against ...
thread.title_full: Church hits out at longer Sunday trading hours as Conservative MPs threaten to rebel against ... - Worldnews.com

author: wn.com
title: Church hits out at longer Sunday trading hours as Conservative MPs threaten to rebel against ...
text: The Church of England has hit out at plans to allow the relaxation of Sunday trading laws in the UK, as David Cameron is facing a rebellion from Conservative MPs over the issue, it has been reported. Chancellor George Osborne unveiled the proposal to give councils the power to relax Sunday trading hours for supermarkets and big retailers in his latest Budget, though it was opposed by supermarket giants and the church. Currently big retailers are able to open for a period of six hours between 10am and 6pm on a Sunday, though small shops are able to open for longer. Shopping tribes of Britain 9 show all
